skill.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, validation tools, and animation concepts. Use when users request animated GIFs for Slack like "make me a GIF of X doing Y for Slack."

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with standard image processing utilities. No security review findings required for this source type.

content.user_title: Create Slack-ready GIFs from custom animations
content.value_statement: You need GIFs that fit Slack size and style limits. This skill builds, optimizes, and validates GIFs with clear animation helpers.
actual_capabilities: Assemble GIFs from PIL images or numpy frames
Resize frames to target dimensions during GIF build
Reduce colors with global or per-frame palettes
Remove near-duplicate frames to shrink file size
Validate GIF dimensions, size, and frame timing for Slack
Draw shapes, text, stars, and gradients for frames
limitations: Requires local Python dependencies: Pillow, imageio, numpy
Does not provide ready-made animation templates
No built-in emoji font rendering support
Validation does not guarantee Slack upload success in all cases

use_cases.title: Standardize emoji GIFs
use_cases.description: Create consistent 128x128 animated emojis that meet size and color guidelines.

use_cases.title: Polish promo loops
use_cases.description: Design short message GIFs with smooth easing and optimized file size.

use_cases.title: Automate GIF builds
use_cases.description: Generate GIFs from code using frame helpers and validation checks.

prompt_templates.title: Make a simple emoji
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 128x128 Slack emoji GIF of a bouncing blue circle for 1.5 seconds at 12 fps, with 48 colors and emoji optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Polished star sparkle
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate frames for a gold star that pulses and rotates, use thick outlines, add a soft glow, then save a Slack-ready emoji GIF.

prompt_templates.title: Validate my GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my.gif meets Slack emoji requirements, report dimensions, size, fps, and whether it is acceptable.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced motion path
prompt_templates.prompt: Animate a rocket moving along an arc with easing, add a gradient background, and save a 480x480 message GIF under 3 seconds.

output_examples.input: Create a 128x128 emoji GIF of a pulsing heart
output: Size 180 KB, optimized for emoji use

best_practices: Keep emoji GIFs under 3 seconds with 10 to 15 fps
Use fewer colors and remove duplicate frames to reduce size
Apply easing functions for smoother motion
anti_patterns: Using emoji fonts or assuming built-in graphics
Creating very high FPS animations for small emojis
Skipping validation before sharing in Slack

faq.question: What platforms can use this skill?
faq.answer: It runs in Python environments with Pillow, imageio, and numpy installed.

faq.question: What are the main limits for Slack emoji GIFs?
faq.answer: Use 128x128 dimensions, short duration, and reduced colors for smaller files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing image pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. It accepts PIL images or numpy arrays and saves optimized GIFs.

faq.question: Does it upload or store my GIFs?
faq.answer: No. It only processes local files and does not transmit data.

faq.question: Why does validation pass but Slack still rejects?
faq.answer: Slack can enforce additional size or content limits beyond dimensions and size.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic GIF tools?
faq.answer: It includes Slack-specific guidance, validation, and optimization defaults.
